law.catch_line: Insurable interest in goods -- Manner of identification of goods.

text.section: The seller retains an insurable interest in goods so long as title to or any security interest in the goods remains in him and where the identification is by the seller alone he may until default or insolvency or notification to the buyer that the identification is final substitute other goods for those identified.
Nothing in this section impairs any insurable interest recognized under any other statute or rule of law.

law.history: Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 77, sec. 2-501, effective July 1, 1960.
